title: (x) Parker Brothers video game cartridges - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Yves}
content:
Does anyone know which typeface is used for the ’A VIDEO GAME CARTRIDGE FROM’ text on the old Atari PB boxes like on [these](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024851/http:/intvfunhouse.com/atari2600/parkerbros/box/qbrt.jpg) [examples](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024851/http:/intvfunhouse.com/atari2600/parkerbros/box/rotj.jpg)?

It is a lighter weight of the Parker Brothers logo without the custom A and is used for most cover text on those boxes.

Any help would be great, best I could find was the Neuzeit variations.

Thanks in advance!

 [‹ (x) Serif typeface used in Dutch graphic design magazine "items" - Collis {Arena}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024851/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14212 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Captain Morgan - Adobe Sans substitution font {Jason (self)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024851/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14223 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kineticpast

comments.content: [ITC Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024851/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.369.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=A+VIDEO+GAME+CARTRIDGE+FROM&sampleSize=18&attributes.paraSize=14&paraSize=14), with the Parker Brothers’ logo using an [alternate A](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024851/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=EF.101895.0.5).

Hahahaha! Maybe I should get some sleep!

Thanks troubleman for pointing out the totally obvious answer and not making me feel like a fool!
